properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.resources-paths
properties.description: Paths to migrations. Internally uses "PathMatchingResourcePatternResolver" so it should starts from "file:" or "classpath:" prefix

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.connection-max-retries
properties.description: Count of retries to connect to database. r2dbc-migrate will retry with fixed interval "validation-retry-delay"

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.validation-retry-delay
properties.description: Delay between trying to get success of validation "validation-query"

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.validation-query
properties.description: Query that used for connection's validation

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.validation-query-expected-result-value
properties.description: If set then "result" column of validation-query will be used to compare with

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.chunk-size
properties.description: Number of lines which will be passed as batch to the connection. Used with "splitted" modifier.

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.acquire-lock-retry-delay
properties.description: Delay between retries to acquire lock

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.acquire-lock-max-retries
properties.description: Count of retries to acquire lock from "migrations_lock" table

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.wait-for-database
properties.description: Should we wait for database has been started ? See alse r2dbc.migrate.validation-query

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.migrations-table
properties.description: Changes migration table name. It will be written with corresponding wrapping (quotes in case PostgreSQL, backticks in case MySQL).

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.migrations-lock-table
properties.description: Changes migration lock table name. It will be written with corresponding wrapping (quotes in case PostgreSQL, backticks in case MySQL).

properties.name: r2dbc.migrate.migrations-schema
properties.description: Changes migration schema. It will be written with corresponding wrapping (quotes in case PostgreSQL, backticks in case MySQL). Default is null - it means that database's default will be selected ("public" for PostgreSQL, "dbo" for MsSQL).

values.description: PostgreSQL connection check with result column.

values.value: SELECT collation_name as result FROM sys.databases WHERE name = N'master'
values.description: Checks that Microsoft SQL Server configuration completed and collation_name is set.
Example of expected value for PostgreSQL connection check.
Example of expected value for Microsoft SQL Server.
